abstract: Relativity Media, the privately held firm that helped finance “Smokin’ Aces” and “Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby,” has joined with Citigroup in a deal to fund at least 45 studio films in the next five years, and possibly as many as 100, according to reports. Variety said the overall investment could reach $1.1 billion, and The New York Post said the co-financing agreement could be one of the largest pools of outsider money to make its way to Hollywood.

headline.main: Private Firm Joins Citi in Big Hollywood Bet
